body:
I have seen that you committed your stuff to the master branch. Don't do this in your next pull requests, it makes rebasing harder. :) Anyway, maybe you can fix it by doing this:

    git fetch origin # Get latest origin
    git checkout -b origin/master # Create a new branch based on origin/master
    git cherry-pick SHA_OF_YOUR_ORIGINAL_COMMIT # Pick your changes in the new branch
    git checkout -b checkbox_patch # Give a name to this new branch
    git push -u origin checkbox_patch # Push the branch

And you just need to resend your pull request. you can close this one and create a new one! Cheers.
